text: Utagawa Kunisada (; 1786 – 12 January 1865), also known as Utagawa Toyokuni III (, ), was a Japanese artist. He was a master of the ukiyo-e style of woodblock prints and painting.Nussbaum, Louis Frédéric et al. (2005). "Kunisada" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 575. ==Gallery== Image:Kunisada yoshiwara.jpg|The Hours of the Yoshiwara, c. 1818 File:Brooklyn Museum - View of Fuji from Miho Bay - Utagawa Toyokuni III (Kunisada).jpg|View of Fuji from Miho Bay, c. 1830 Image:Kunisada futamigaura.jpg|Dawn at Futamigaura, c. 1830 File:Hana No En.jpg|Under the Cherry Blossoms, 1852 ==References== == Other websites == * The Utagawa Kunisada Project * List of Kunisada pictures * Kunisada Category:Japanese printmakers Category:1786 births Category:1865 deaths Category:People from Tokyo
title: Utagawa Kunisada
